alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 03 at 1:22PM PST until March 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties and Modoc County in California, and Klamath County and Western Lake County in Oregon, including Klamath Falls, Tulelake, Alturas, Lakeview, Bly, Chemult, Crescent, and portions of Highways 140, 97, 395, 31, 39, and 139. * WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult at times. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
